section.title: Introduction
section.para: FlyMine is an integrated database of genomic, expression and protein data for Drosophila, Anopheles and C. elegans. Integrating data makes it possible to run sophisticated data mining queries that span domains of biological knowledge. Use aspect icons below to to find out more about types of data in FlyMine and to start queries. Use FlyMine to:
Browse data - Browse by aspect using the icons below or enter any identifier or symbol in the search box to the right to access summary pages and integrated tools. Tutorial 1

Run Template Queries - A library of pre-defined ('template') queries that simply require filling in a form is available. Find lists of templates on each aspect page or use the Template Search box below. Tutorial 2

Operate on lists - All queries in FlyMine can be performed on lists (or 'bags'). For example, any query that operates on a single gene could be done on a list of gene identifiers you create yourself. Tutorial 3

Design your own query - Advanced users can use a flexible query interface to construct their own data mining queries or modify existing template queries. Start a query by choosing a class on an aspect page, browsing the model or viewing a list of all classes. You can save queries for future use and create your own templates by creating an account. See the user manual and tutorials for more information.

section.title: Funding and contact details
section.para: The FlyMine project is based at the Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge and is a collaboration between the Genetics and Biochemistry departments of the University of Cambridge.
